resources.string: Rectilinear Uniformly Accelerated Motion or MRUA is motion that occurs along a straight line with constant acceleration. In the MRUA the acceleration is constant, it will never change, it is always the same. Be very careful, the constant is the acceleration, not the speed.
Please enter two values, leaving the field you want to find empty:
Please enter the values ​​you have on hand:

Parabolic free fall motion, or MPCL, is a motion whose trajectory is a curve called a parabola. whose trajectory is a curve called parabola, in which the mobile moves only under the influence of gravity once it is released (in vacuum, without air). the influence of gravity once it is released (in vacuum, without air).

The parabolic free fall motion is a compound motion consisting of 2 simultaneous and independent movements. movements that are performed at the same time and independently of each other. In the horizontal axis \"x\" a uniform rectilinear motion or MRU a uniform rectilinear motion or MRU; while on the vertical \"y\" axis a vertical free fall motion or MVCL is developed.

"Where: 

Vo : initial velocity. 
Vox : initial velocity on the x-axis (horizontal component). 

Voy : initial velocity on the y-axis (vertical component)."

Where: 

d :distance traveled on the "x" or horizontal axis. 
t : travel time.

The Vertical Ascending Shot is the one in which a body is launched towards the sky. At the body has a maximum velocity, starting from the hand or machinery that is launching it. machinery that is launching it. Subsequently, as it travels through the air, the acceleration of gravity will counteract this movement, slowing it down. counteracting this movement, slowing the object little by little, with a negative acceleration of 9.8 m/s2. of 9.8 m/s2. When it reaches a vertical velocity of 0 m/s, it will be suspended in the air for an instant, to be immediately immediately be affected by the acceleration of gravity, now in a positive sense, experiencing a fall in positive direction, experiencing a Free Fall.
"It is used to calculate the height at any instant of time. h = Vo * t + ½ * g * t². "

Vf = Final velocity (we can also symbolize it as Vf), in the vertical shot it is zero. 
Vo = Initial velocity. In the vertical pull it cannot be zero (otherwise it would not start). 
t = time. 
h = height.

"The vertical free fall motion or MVCL is a motion in which the mobile describes a vertical trajectory and moves only under the influence of gravity once it is released. describes a vertical trajectory and moves only under the influence of gravity once it is released. "

" Vf = Final velocity. 
Vo = Initial velocity. 
t = time. 
g = acceleration of gravity or gravity (9.8 m/s²). 
h = height traveled. 
hn : height traveled in the nth second."
Uniformly accelerated circular motion (UACM) is a circular motion whose angular acceleration α is constant. Therefore, as time progresses, its velocity changes constantly.

"ω0 = initial angular velocity (rad/s). 
ωf = final angular velocity (rad/s). 
α = tangential acceleration (rad/s²). 
t = time (s). 
θ = angular displacement (rad)."

"
Vf = final tangential speed (m/s). 
Vo = initial tangential velocity (m/s). 
at = tangential acceleration (m/s²). 
t = time (s). 
L = arc length (m)"
Uniform circular motion or UCC is the motion of an object describing a circular path with constant speed. a circular trajectory with constant speed. The speed of the mobile will never change.

"θ = angular displacement (rad). 
ω= angular velocity (rad/s). 
t = time (s). 
L = arc length (m). 
V = tangential speed (m/s). 
R = radius of gyration (m/s). 
ac = centripetal acceleration (m/s²). 
T = period (s). Refers to the time taken to make one complete revolution. 
f = frequency (Hz). It is the number of turns per unit time that the body makes."

"Hmax = ( Vo² * Sen²Θ ) / ( 2 * g ) 
Tvuelo = ( 2 * Vo * SenΘ) / ( g ) 
R=( Vo² * sen2Θ ) / ( g ) 

Where: 
Hmax : Altura maxima. 
Tvuelo :Tiempo de vuelo. 
R : Alcance horizontal. 
Θ : ángulo del vector velocidad inicial con el eje horizontal x "

Vfy = Voy ± g * t 
h = Voy * t ± (g * t²) /2 
 h=( Voy + Vfy ) / ( 2 ) * t 
Vfy² = Voy² ± 2 * g * h 

Where: 

Vfy :velocidad final en el eje «y». 
g : aceleración de la gravedad (g = 9,8 m/s²).
"Vox = Vo * CosΘ | Voy = Vo * SenΘ Vo = √( Vox² + Voy² ) "
Uniform rectilinear motion or MRU is a motion in a straight line with constant velocity.

Distance: meters (m). 

Time: seconds (s). 

velocity: meters per second (m/s).
